Tools.name: WebStorm
Tools.description: I have used this IDE in the past for web projects, I liked its cool features, especially for testing and the control version.

Tools.name: intelliJ
Tools.description: For a java project a university, I used intelliJ to learn about software development, with tests, and CI / CD, managed by Maven.

Tools.name: Visual Studio Code
Tools.description: VScode is my everyday tool, I like to configure it to meet all my needs.

Tools.name: Git
Tools.description: I use Git for all my projects and I'm still learning to explore all the features provided by Git.

Tools.name: GitHub
Tools.description: Coupled with git, Github is the main tool I use to manage my projects and collaborate on team projects. I often set up a CI / CD system to keep control.

Tools.name: GitLab
Tools.description: As an alternative to GitHub, I have sometimes used GitLab, for the same purposes.

Tools.name: Eclipse
Tools.description: I used eclipse for my first java projects, although it is quite handy, now I prefer to use IntelliJ.

Languages and frameworks.name: HTML5
Languages and frameworks.description: Since I've been using HTML for quite a long time now, I'm trying to improve my code for SEO or accessibility purposes.

Languages and frameworks.name: JavaScript
Languages and frameworks.description: I am used to coding with JavaScript in all my web projects, client or server side. I really like this language and its multiple paradigms, functional and object-oriented programming.

Languages and frameworks.name: Scss
Languages and frameworks.description: I often prefer use Scss instead of css, to organize my codebase easily.

Languages and frameworks.name: PHP
Languages and frameworks.description: It is the first server language I learned, I used it for many web projects.

Languages and frameworks.name: Node
Languages and frameworks.description: I have been using node for a year, and I really like it, to develop APis, or socket server.

Languages and frameworks.name: React
Languages and frameworks.description: By discovering progressive web applications, I learned React, and I found this framework really practical to manage the user interface with many components, for me it is a good alternative to vanilla JS, to create applications without huge frameworks.

Languages and frameworks.name: Java
Languages and frameworks.description: I started to learn computer science with java, then I used it to discover object oriented paradigms.

Languages and frameworks.name: MySQL
Languages and frameworks.description: For software or web applications I often use MySql to manage the database. I learned two years ago how to design and normalization database.

Languages and frameworks.name: MongoDB
Languages and frameworks.description: Instead of MySQL I sometimes use MongoDb for the database, for Node APIs for example. I found it interesting to learn how to manage NoSql databases.

Languages and frameworks.name: Ruby
Languages and frameworks.description: I discovered ruby ​​this year, I liked it a lot, and I would like to continue with the Ruby On Rails web framework.

Languages and frameworks.name: Scheme
Languages and frameworks.description: In order to learn the functional programming paradigm, I learned Scheme, I liked this paradigm, even though this language is not really practical.

Languages and frameworks.name: UML
Languages and frameworks.description: For analysis and modeling in projects, I use UML to create diagrams of different types and collaborate more easily with others.

Languages and frameworks.name: C
Languages and frameworks.description: I first learned C to discover data structures and algorithms complexity, then for system and network programming with linux.

Languages and frameworks.name: C++
Languages and frameworks.description: After the C, I learned C++ in the language theory course, to manipulate automatons. I will soon have a course on C++ to deepen its multiple paradigms.

Languages and frameworks.name: Bash
Languages and frameworks.description: To manipulate unix systems, I use bash (or dash) scripts, I used it to create some automation tools.

Languages and frameworks.name: Ubuntu
Languages and frameworks.description: Since working with dual Windows / Linux boot, I use Ubuntu or derivative distributions like Elementary OS.
